thread.title: Beaches packed as Australians cope with brutal heatwave | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Beaches packed as Australians cope with brutal heatwave | Daily Mail Online

author: Anton Nilsson For Daily Mail Australia
title: Beaches packed as Australians cope with brutal heatwave | Daily Mail Online
text: Beaches were packed over the weekend as Australians coped with a brutal heatwave. Those lucky enough to be close to water dove in to escape the muggy heat. Many took to social media to post pictures from the shore - reminding everyone who were spending time inland to get their priorities straight. One person showed it was hot enough to cook an egg in the sun. Temperatures in Sydney were expected to soar to 39 degrees on Saturday, according to the Bureau of Meteorology. The city's outer suburbs were set to be even hotter - with Richmond and Penrith beating the rest at 46 degrees Celsius. Beaches were packed over the weekend as Australians coped with a brutal heatwave. These surfers posed for a picture at Bondi Beach Those lucky enough to be close to water dove in to escape the muggy heat on Saturday Scorcher: Temperatures in Sydney were expected to soar to 39 degrees on Saturday, according to the Bureau of Meteorology Trying to escape the heat, this dog found the coolest spot in the house: the shower This social media user showed it was hot enough to cook an egg in the sun Almost at the beach: Many in NSW took the opportunity to hit the beaches. This woman posed for a picture at Sydney's Clovelly Beach Many took to social media to post pictures from the shore- reminding everyone who were spending time inland to get their priorities straight. Pictured, Bondi's outdoor pool Temperatures in Sydney were expected to soar to 39 degrees on Saturday - perfect for a day at the beach The nation's furriest had different methods of chilling out, including drinking ice water, and sitting in a pool These cats cooled down in front of a fan on Saturday, as NSW was hit by a heatwave According to this person's dashboard thermometer, the outside temperature was measured at a brutal 52 degrees These pooches licked a block of ice to cool down during Saturday's heatwave This woman took a dip at sunset on Thursday evening, right before the heatwave struck This bird chose to hang out in the fridge as temperatures soared in NSW over the weekend Sweating like pigs: These swine were showered in cool water as temperatures peaked on Saturday Share or comment on this article 173
